name: Natchez National Historical Park
description: Discover the history of all the peoples of Natchez, Mississippi, from European settlement, African enslavement, the American cotton economy, to the Civil Rights struggle on the lower Mississippi River.
shortDescription: Discover the history of all the peoples of Natchez, Mississippi, from European settlement, African enslavement, the American cotton economy, to the Civil Rights struggle on the lower Mississippi River...

operatingHours.description: The Natchez Visitor Center is currently closed due to the installation of a new HVAC system.  Melrose is open 7 days a week with guided tours of the mansion at 10:00, 11:00 am, 2:00, 3:00, and 4:00. Reservations for the tour should be made on Recreation.gov.  The first floor of the William Johnson House is open although the second floor containing the family living quarters remains closed at this time.   The Fort Rosalie site is open daily from sunup to sundown, as is the Forks of the Road site.

climate.weatherDescription: Spring: Temperatures usually range from 50 F to 83 F. Rain is common. Summer: Temperatures usually range from 70 F to 95 F. Rain and sun are equally common. On very sunny days, be prepared with plenty of water - heat exhaustion is common if you are not prepared. Fall: Temperatures usually range from 55 F to 79 F. Winter: Temperatures range from 40 F to 63 F. Rain is common.

images.title: Melrose Mansion
images.altText: Two story brick mansion with columns
images.caption: Melrose and its landscape present a comprehensive picture of the Southern planter class and the enslaved people who lived and worked there.

images.title: William Johnson House
images.caption: The William Johnson House provides a window into the life of a free man of color whose published diary and personal papers provide a detailed account of daily life in the antebellum south.

images.title: Melrose Slave Cabin
images.altText: One story wood frame house with two doors and two windows
images.caption: One of two remaining slave cabins at the Melrose estate

images.title: Inside Melrose Slave Cabin
images.altText: Room containing very simple wood table and chair, and baby cradle with fireplace in background
images.caption: The furnished slave cabin at Melrose helps to illustrate  the daily life of the enslaved.

images.title: Inside the William Johnson House
images.altText: room with tall windows and fireplace, round table containing lamp and surrounded by chairs
images.caption: Visitors to the William Johnson House can see many original furnishings.
